title: 109_hr3075
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Health Care Reform Act of 2005" includes a refundable credit for health care costs under Section 35 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Comprehensive Health Care Reform Act of 2005 includes a refundable credit for health care costs against the taxpayer's income tax and social security taxes. The credit cannot exceed the sum of the taxpayer's net income tax and social security taxes for the year. Double benefits are not allowed when claiming the credit. The Comprehensive Health Care Reform Act of 2005 introduces a refundable credit for health care costs against income tax and social security taxes. The credit cannot exceed the total of the taxpayer's net income tax and social security taxes. Double benefits are prohibited when claiming the credit.
